intro: Psychotria aquatica subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a herbaceous species that typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and stream banks. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in inflorescences. It is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal properties. The species is notable for its role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
